intro: Pleurospermum pseudoyunnanense, commonly known as the Yunnan pleurospermum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to brown flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
